info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Be Alert for Patchy Dense Fog During the Morning Commute... Moist ground and light or calm wind have allowed for patchy dense fog to develop early this morning, especially in river and mountain valleys. Visibility of 1/2 mile or less has been noted at locations within the Greenbrier Valley, the New River Valley, and along and near the Interstate 77 corridor, including Lewisburg WV, Blacksburg VA, and Hillsville VA. If you are planning travel early this morning through the hour after daybreak, be alert for areas of patchy dense fog. Visibility will be highly variable from one location to another such as from a ridge to a nearby valley where visibility may change quickly from unrestricted to nearly zero. Reduce speed, use low beam headlights, allow extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
